“The plot thickens... while we were trying to enjoy Christmas amid the plandemic and Nashville bombing, a fire completely destroyed City Blue Imaging Services in Rochester, New York. Why is that significant... because they are the print shop responsible for the flawed and misleading ballots in New York. I’m sure it’s just a coincidence,” says a December 28, 2020 Facebook post.
The claim also appears on Facebook here and here, on Instagram here and on Twitter here and here.

US President Donald Trump has repeatedly made unfounded allegations of fraud in the 2020 presidential election, which he lost to Democrat Joe Biden. AFP Fact Check has debunked a series of inaccurate claims about vote fraud here.
The City Blue Imaging building was destroyed by a fire on December 24, but the company says it does not print ballots.
“NO, we do not do ballot printing. We don’t have the equipment and it’s not a specialty we would be involved with. We are mainly doing blue printing and marketing,” it tweeted on December 27.

Posts also say City Blue Imaging misprinted ballots. But this was an issue with Rochester’s Phoenix Graphics, and City Blue Imaging said on Facebook it does not work for nor was it owned by that company.

And some posts attempt to connect the fire at City Blue Imaging to a false claim that a bombing in Nashville, Tennessee was linked to an AT&T audit of machines from Dominion Voting Systems, an election technologies company that has been repeatedly targeted by Trump and his supporters with false accusations of involvement in vote fraud.
AT&T and Dominion previously told AFP Fact Check that no such audit was taking place.
